VLOCITY HEALTH
Enrollment Overview

Vlocity's enrollment features and services are specifically designed for a wide variety of enrollment requirements and scenarios.

Some of these scenarios are:

Enrolling a brand new group of members and their dependents, as a first-time setup for a new company;

Enrolling a new member or members and dependents into existing plans, as in the case of a new hire;

Retrieving current enrollment plans, based on a census Id, and allow members to make benefit changes, such as during an open enrollment period;

Allowing members to modify their enrollment, with add, remove, or opt out features.

TIP

During the initial enrollment period, employees are allowed to waive their rights to coverage for any benefits being offered.

Vlocity can record when an employee opts out of products. To enable this, go to Setup > Company Settings > Data Protection and Privacy, and check the Make data protection details available in records checkbox.

From Vlocity Health and Vlocity Insurance Summer '21 release onwards, the service also supports the Person Account flow.

Vlocity's enrollment and census features are tightly integrated, so you can upload a census into Vlocity, create Contact records for those census members, and enroll them into plans.

Here's what that looks like, with the services involved to make it happen:

Small Group Enrollment Scenarios

Here's a quick look at some common small group enrollment scenarios and the personas involved in the process.

Broker Enrollment

A small group broker often provides personalized service for a small business owner or plan administrator by guiding them through rates, product offerings and selections, and the actual enrollment of members.

Enrollment may include taking physical paper forms and entering the data from the form into a formatted file, like a CSV, in order to upload member and plan selection data.

NOTE

Brokers often need to manually transform the file into a standardized template, which can be a tedious effort and prone to human errors. A bulk import tool or wizard may be used to confirm eligibility, demographic information, dependents, or make plan elections.

Plan Benefits Administrator

In this scenario, a small group employer is given a secure portal login and makes elections on behalf of their employees as the plan benefits administrator. This might also be performed by a third-party administrator (TPA) hired by the employer and acting on their behalf.

Internal Carrier Representative

A healthcare insurance company may have an internal carrier representative for the small group, who aggregates data and processes for the group.

Member Portal during Open Enrollment

During an open enrollment period, a member logs directly into the member portal and is guided through a process to make elections for their eligible plans.

Enrollment Services

Vlocity has over a dozen enrollment and census specific services that can be used for enrollment tasks. These are grouped together in an OmniScript flow to provide a comprehensive end-to-end enrollment experience.

Generally speaking, these enrollment tasks can be broken down into three broad categories:

Enroll—Load a new or updated census with plan members.

Retrieve—Use census member IDs to get current enrollment plans for a member and dependents, so they can make benefit changes.

Modify—Allow users to add or remove applicable plans, and add or remove dependents. Users can also opt out of plans altogether.

Product Enrollment Data with a Census

You can upload product enrollment data (medical, dental, vision) with census members, either via OmniScript or spreadsheet. The services involved in that are:

getFieldsInsCensusService: getFields—Retrieves field definitions and field API names for group census members and group census plans;

getMembersWithPlansInsCensusService: getMembersWithPlans—Retrieves members of a census and their pre-enrolled plans, as well as field definitions;

updateMembersWithPlansInsCensusService: updateMembersWithPlans—Populates a census with primary members, their dependents, and their pre-enrolled plan;

addPlanSelectionsInsCensusService: addPlanSelections—Inserts pre-enrolled plans for each member specified in the input;

updateMembersInsCensusService: updateMembersWithPlans—Populates a census with primary members and their dependents.

The spreadsheet census file itself can also include product enrollment information along with member and dependent data (name, birthdate, and so forth). To accommodate this, the mapper supports mapping of spreadsheet columns for products.

TIP

Check out the Uploading a Census from the Census Uploader topic for full details on how to setup the OmniScript.

Add Members and Dependents
To associate a member for enrollment, get their User, Contact, Account, and Contract Ids by adding an Omnistudio Data Mapper as an extract action in the Script Configuration section of the OmniScript structure.
Adding Enrollment Products
You need to configure the enrollment OmniScript to provide a list of all the available healthcare products.
Configuring Enrollment Selection Summary
The Selection Summary section of the enrollment OmniScript structure uses a specific template, Omnistudio Data Mapper, and remote action to configure the completion steps of the enrollment process.
Enrollment Marketing Events
During an enrollment period, you may want to create marketing events to educate and inform members about new plans, changes to plans, and so forth. For Medicare sales and group enrollment, funds can be requested for a marketing event by adding an enrollment event to an Account record.
Enrollment Services
There are a number of enrollment specific services available as part of the InsEnrollmentService class.
